name: Transverse
desc: Transverse loop sweeping through aorta

name: Proximal Aorta
desc:
One of four transverse still views (Proximal, Mid, Distal, and Bifurcation).
Must show liver, celiac vessels, and spine

name: Mid Aorta
desc:
One of four transverse still views (Proximal, Mid, Distal, and Bifurcation).
Must show liver, SMA, and spine

name: Distal Aorta
desc:
One of four transverse still views (Proximal, Mid, Distal, and Bifurcation).
Must show spine

name: Aortic Bifurcation
desc:
One of four transverse still views (Proximal, Mid, Distal, and Bifurcation).
Must show spine

name: Sagittal
desc: Sagittal loop of the Aorta.

name: Frame + Measure
desc:
Sagittal frame of the Aorta.
Measure outer-to-outer 2cm distal to the SMA.
Nromal aorta < 3mm.
Normal iliac arteries < 1.5mm

name: Parasternal Long
desc: Must show descending thoracic aorta

name: Parasternal Short
desc: Must show papillary muscles, mitral valve, and aortic valve

name: Apical Four Chamber
desc: The interventricular septum must be vertically aligned in the view

name: Subxiphoid
desc: Assess for pericardial effusion

name: Common Femoral Vein
desc: Must include from the saphenofemoral junction through the bifurcation of the common femoral vein to superficial and deep

name: Popliteal Vein
desc: Must include the popliteal vein throught the bifurcation with trifurcation

name: Superficial Femoral Vein
desc:
Image of the Common Femoral Vein
Compressed every 1-2cm to the knee

name: RUQ
desc: Central venous pressure and diaphragm

name: LUQ
desc: Slide the following structures Lung - Diaphragm - Spleen - Caudal tip of the Spleen - Inferior renal pole

name: Sagittal Suprapubic
desc: Fan across a sagittal view of the bladder

name: Transv. Suprapubic
desc: Fan across a transverse view of the bladder

name: Subxiphoid
desc: Fan across a subxiphoid view of the Heart

name: Right Lung
desc: Slide across 3 rib spaces

name: Left Lung
desc: Slide across 2 rib spaces

name: Sagittal
desc: Fan through the gallbladder from a sagittal perspective

name: Transverse
desc: Fan through the gallbladder from a transverse perspective

name: Anterior Wall
desc:
Measure the anterior wall of the gallbladder.
Optimize with zoom.
Normal < 3mm

name: Common Bile Duct
desc:
Measure the CBD internal diamater in the Porta Hepatis or in the sagittal gallbladder exclamatino point or the Mickey Mouse sign.
Optimize with color and zoom.
Normal <6mm (include age adjustments)

name: Heart
desc: Assess heart rate, EF, and contractility

name: IVC
desc: Assess vena cava responsiveness with respiration

name: Morrison's Pouch
desc: Assess Morison's pouch for potential internal bleeding

name: Aorta
desc: Assess aorta for potential ruptured abdominal aortic aneurysm

name: Pulmonary
desc: Assess lungs for potential tension pneumothorax

name: Measurement
desc: Measure width of IVC

name: Respiratory Variation
desc:
Measure width of IVC with inspiration.
Does it change by >50%?

name: Sagittal
desc:
Sagittal view of the uterus.
Confirm IUP (yolk sac present?).
Gestational sac/Double Decidual sign is insufficient to confirm IUP.

name: Transverse
desc:
Transverse view of the uterus.
Confirm IUP (yolk sac present?).
Gestational sac/Double Decidual sign is insufficient to confirm IUP.

name: Crown Rump Length
desc: Assessment of crown rump length

name: EMM
desc: Measurement of EMM (IUP > 8mm)

name: Fetal Heart Rate
desc: If FHR measured, must use M-mode. Avoid pulse wave doppler

name: Right Adnexa
desc: Examination of right adnexa for potential mass

name: Left Adnexa
desc: Examination of left adnexa for potential mass

name: Sagittal
desc:
Sagittal view of the uterus.
Confirm IUP

name: Transverse
desc:
Transverse view of the uterus.
Confirm IUP

name: Biparietal Diameter
desc: Measurement of one parietal bone to another, used to estimate fetal weight and gestational age.

name: Head Circumference
desc: Measurement of the head circumference

name: Femur Length
desc: Measurement of fetal femur length

name: Fetal Heart Rate
desc: If FHR measured, must use M-mode. Avoid pulse wave doppler

name: Transverse
desc:
Fan through the transverse view of the eye.
Increase gain to assess for hemorrhage and detachment.

name: Transverse ONSD
desc:
Transverse measurement of the optic nerve sheath.
Average the value obtained with the sagittal ONSD

name: Sagittal
desc:
Fan through the sagittal view of the eye.
Increase gain to assess for hemorrhage and detachment.

name: Sagittal ONSD
desc:
Sagittal measurement of the optic nerve sheath.
Average the value obtained with the sagittal ONSD

name: Left Sagittal
desc: Sagittal view of the left kidney

name: Left Measurement
desc: Measurement of the left kidney

name: Left Transverse
desc: Transverse view of the left kidney

name: Right Sagittal
desc: Sagittal view of the right kidney

name: Right Measurement
desc: Measurement of the right kidney

name: Right Transverse
desc: Transverse view of the right kidney

name: Sagittal
desc: Sagittal view of the kidney

name: Transverse
desc: Transverse view of the kidney

name: Sagittal Normal
desc: Sagittal view of the normal soft tissue/MSK

name: Transverse Normal
desc: Transverse view of the normal soft tissue/MSK

name: Sagittal Abnormal
desc:
Sagittal view of the abnormal soft tissue/MSK.
Mowing the lawn technique

name: Sagittal Abnormal
desc:
Transverse view of the abnormal soft tissue/MSK.
Mowing the lawn technique

name: Measurement
desc:
Sagittal view of the normal soft tissue/MSK.
Save a frame with size and depth

name: Anterior
desc:
Anterior view of the lung, must be done bilaterally.
Minimum depth of 15cm to assess for B lines.
Acute interstitial syndrome = at least 3 B-lines in 2 rib spaces on both sides of the chest

name: Lateral
desc:
Lateral view of the lung, must be done bilaterally.
Minimum depth of 15cm to assess for B lines.
Diaphragm can be merged into the lateral or posterior views.
Acute interstitial syndrome = at least 3 B-lines in 2 rib spaces on both sides of the chest

name: Posterior
desc:
Posterior view of the lung, must be done bilaterally.
Minimum depth of 15cm to assess for B lines.
Diaphragm can be merged into the lateral or posterior views.
Acute interstitial syndrome = at least 3 B-lines in 2 rib spaces on both sides of the chest

name: CVP/Diaphragm
desc: Central venous pressure and diaphragm
